archimate:ArchimateDiagramModel.name: Bookeeping Voukko
archimate:ArchimateDiagramModel.documentation:
Documents=vouchers - salses invoices, purchase invocies, bank account ransactions, (payments), Ajustmens (at least yearly), deprecations, reconcilations Archiving rules Reports= monthly/quaterly, VAT reports, yearly tax
Minimum requirements for software to follow the rules

children.content:
Bookkeeping
Sales invoices (receivables) - Every month we transfer from sales to bookeeping
Purchase invoices (payables) - invoice approval system - Payables - Payments - Every month we transfer from payables to Bookeeping (GL)
Salaries and wages - Entries to bookeeping (summary by account)

VAT is handled in bookkeeping VAT is separated from total amounts by - vat codes or - vat specific account numbers - or ented manually
VAT amounts end up to balance sheet accounts VAT payable and VAT receivale VAT report is acalculation from bookiping entries
VAT book keeping - focus on this - and everything else become bad quality

What is the difference between traditional system and XBRL GL database?
Traditional - ERPs are Closed system (processes/modules are connected and cannot be replaced)
Future: - purchase invoices/purchase orders, sales invoices, bank accounts are structured (XML) - standard interface - approval process (validation) - xml files is entered into one database - just files in XBRL GL taxonomy - date, docuemnt type, number, description, measurable code description, masure quantity, measurable unit of measure, tax amount, tax percenteage rate, amount, account main id, reporting code - individual applications - for sales, purchases, ... replacable
Benefit: real-time is dayly and not one month and a half.
